website_summaries.verdict: Able to tackle large projects on a charged battery, easy to adjust, and extremely reliable; you can’t go wrong with this premium nail gun.
cons: This nail gun is a little on the heavy side

customer_reviews.title: Badass
customer_reviews.text: This is a great nailer. There's no wind up time, delivers nails with immediate action. The ability to set the depth to varying degrees works great for a variety of projects. I had originally planned on getting the Milwaukee but after reading some reviews and watching some demos I decided to go with this and I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Houghton

customer_reviews.title: it is huge like everyone says. Wastes nails. Constantly changing nails because capacity is small.
customer_reviews.text: I like it but not thoroughly impressed. Doesn't hold many nails. About a half inch of nails is wasted on every strip because it wont use the last section and jams if you try to put two strips together. I yet to have a jam at the usual spot though.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Works great like any other DEWALT product I own and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great like any other DEWALT product I own and it is much quieter than using an air compressor. It is bulky so in tight areas you may need to pull out the compressor and air gun, but otherwise it is awesome. Only other thing is there is a slight learning curve when nailing certain woods. I noticed that on some softer wood and plywood it would make small dents around the nail hole--probably from me pressing the tip too hard against the wood, but I never had that issue with a nailer hooked up to an air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my dewalt toolset. The nailer worked great for my baseboards and my closet shelves. It has 2 settings. 1. For single nail per trigger pull. 2. Hold the trigger and lift and press for each of the following nails.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dejulia

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally pulled the “trigger!”
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad that I finally spent money on this nail gun. Like others said, it’s pretty large and heavy-especially with a large battery, but it’s well worth it. The nail gun is extremely powerful, and this performed every job without a misfire. I highly recommend taking the leap and going compressorless.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Much heavier than an air driven pin gun.
customer_reviews.text: With the 6ah battery this baby is a taste heavy.Like anything new you need to know its quirks.Drives a 2 inch pin intoan old hard 4x4 with ease.Adjustable pin depth.Extra protectors onboard.Typical pain in the butt safety ,if you squirm the nose you need to reset the gun.I had to remove the nose protector to shot it on much of an angle...Shoots quickly ..bang.bang.bang..Think Ill use the 4ah batteries I have for other tools..This is definitely an upgrade to firing up the compressor and dragging airlines around.Just not as light.
customer_reviews.author: Renegade

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Kinda too good to be true. Just put a battery in and start nailing. Ive had zero miss fires in two weeks of trimming a home.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn p

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how I functioned before owning this thing. It’s not that I did a ton of finish carpentry but any time I had to redo a door casing or put back a piece of base I had to eithe do it by hand or drag out the hose and compressor. This makes the job 30 seconds. The batteries last forever (5ah) and I have had 1 jam in 1000 nails so the function is almost flawless
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Jamming
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a month and only used a handful of times and already jamming up.
customer_reviews.author: Mother and Business Owner

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Wish I had bought it ages ago. Makes assembly work so much easier for many projects. Good depth control, and easy to use. Only complaint would be that it is a lot heavier than a pneumatic gun, but worth the trade off to me because it is so versatile. No need to haul around a compressor or air hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Never buy one that is used.
customer_reviews.text: I brought one Used-Good. However, the thing constantly JAMS. It looks as though the spring blade that shoots the brads is bent which causes it to jam. Since I brought it used the manufacturer warranty is void and I only had 30 days to return it. I have to pay to have it repaired, and the 50 bucks off probably won't cover that.
customer_reviews.author: Holly R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to arsenal of nailers to own.
customer_reviews.text: Better than sliced bread! Love this thing. No compressor or hose to plug around. A little more bulky than pneumatic but so convenient. Will not fire when clip gets down to five Brad's but if you keep slide full really not an issue. Excellent battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I

customer_reviews.title: It's "GIGANTIC"
customer_reviews.text: Nailer is great, tip is perfect for tight spots, unit will hammer all day long. very good recovery after each shot. The nail gun is GIGANTIC in size., and much heaver than it needs to be. The reason it looks so big in the photo is because its GIGANTIC. The physical size could be cut in half. The body of this brad nailer is the size of a framing nailer. Not exaggerating. I did not return it because it does perform and I have Dewalt tools and batteries, however i wish i went with the Hitachi
customer_reviews.author: Willie Horton

customer_reviews.title: This thing flat out rules.  I am in love. Nathan was right!
customer_reviews.text: My friend Nathan said, "Hey Chris, did you see that DeWalt makes a cordless brad nailer now?" and I said "No way, I will have to check it out." Then he said "Cool. " and then I said "Cool." Please let it be known that upon receiving the item I immediately fell in love with it. It is super easy to use right out of the box. I am now a better husband because of this product, as I am now completing more projects around the house which makes my wife a far happier person, which in turn makes the house a far better place to live.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this nailer to replace a KIMO that turned out to be inadequate and was returned. I have used it only for a couple of pads of 1-1/4" brads and have yet to have a misfire or have the brad set less than perfectly. For me PRO Fast, relatively quiet, accurate in location and brad depth. Wide range of brad lengths supported. For me CON It is large and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: The Fiddl3r

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what you're missing
customer_reviews.text: Have used nailers for decades. NOT having to mess with the compressor and hoses is wonderful. NOT sure how it would hold up all day if trim carpentry is what you do all day every day. I'm just a do it yourselfer around the home / garage. Used it to trim out a 1700 sq ft garage and worked great. The plastic thing that goes on the tip goes flying off occasionally; would have been nice if they had included a few of these in the kit. Adjustment knob for depth of nail works very well. Very thin / light stuff, I was still able to make it work well without blowing the nail right through the board.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So much better for basic cabinet/drawer building. I am much more likely to pull this out and use it than my compressor-driven one.
customer_reviews.author: David Worsham

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: This nailer sure beats lugging around a pancake compressor and hose to a job site for cabinet and furniture installations. Works great. I use it with a 3 amp hour battery and it lasts a long time. I wish it was a little smaller and lighter, but you can't have everything I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal F Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Almost flawless...
customer_reviews.text: Functions well, operations are easy. I haven’t had any issues other then it tends to misfire once it’s down the the last couple nails in the clip... if it’s a full clip it functions flawlessly. Hope this helps. (Not a profesional by any means, just a simple home owner with day to day projects). Hope this helped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 18GA nailer that works great
customer_reviews.text: I am not a contractor, so I am not putting that kind of cycles on the tool. I am a Dewalt user and this one pretty much lives up to the other experiences I have with Dewalt. I have driven long nails into hardwood like Oak and it has worked great. Battery life is plenty for my use. I also have the 15GA finish nailer and these two seem to operate very similarly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts hit this came through with flying colors. It accepted my Hitachi brad nails, did 2 rooms without charging, probably could still go more. Was powerful, fast and never jammed once.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Harp

customer_reviews.title: Great power.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I though but plenty of power. You can replete fire without any wait time. This won’t be my everyday nailer but when I don’t want to haul around a compressor and hose I will use the hell out of this. The light is in the rear but it would be nicer if there was another light closer to the tip.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt cordless tools are wonderfull, i havent used mine much but it worked fine, no jamr yet. I was suprised by the way they operate. The motor turns on when you first pull the triger then it fires the nail. The light is very helpfull. I found amazon price much less than the home stores, after i bought mine from amazon, a few weeks later the home stores reduced their prices to equal amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all no matter what I did.
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY disappointed. Device arrived not functioning. The trigger engage system does not engage and turn on the unit. The depth adjustment does not work at all, I can't even turn the dial. I couldn't even get this thing to turn on. So totally bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 18 gauge but mine does make a weird sound.
customer_reviews.text: Love this gun. I have used several battery 18 gauges and I do say this one is my favorite. It is consistent and fast. Only thing I don't like is the fact that when the gun is on it's right side it make a harsher grinding or rubbing sound which I'm sure it isn't supposed to. Did this straight from first use. Doesn't seem to affect it but am a little disappointed regardless because I'd expect perfection from a premium electric 18 gauge like this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven DiPolito

customer_reviews.title: Nice nailer! Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Nailer works great for moldings and attaching wood ceilings. Highly recommend! I also have an air nailer but this one works great for those jobs that you don’t feel like hoses laying around. I will still use my air nailer for my hardwood floors but other jobs I’ll use this dewalt battery nailer
customer_reviews.author: Ann or Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer. I purchased this to replace another nailer I have had for several years that had been causing me problems. This nailer has had zero misfires, jams, etc. it cost more but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: High quality brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: Ive never owned a cordless brad nailer but this tool does the job. From what I hear, it’s way more convenient than a pneumatic nail gun, which is why I went with it. My only grip is the brad nails do occasionally get jammed in the gun. It maybe user error so I won’t knock a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: kyleh

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than standard brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: This nailer works great, but it is much bulkier than a standard air powered brad nailer. I understand that it may need to be this size to make it battery operated. Works great when you have just a few nails to drive and don't want to string out an air hose. I would absolutely recommend it for that, for larger jobs, I think I would string out the air hose.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome brad nailer battery operated can't wait to buy the battery operated framing nailer next
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that dewalt came out with this brad nailer with a battery it is so much easier than using an air compressor and hose dragging it all around the house. It makes life a thousand times easier! Great product works amazing!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: What else is there to say, no air hose!!!`
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this nailer. It is a little big but WELL worth the trade off of dragging around an air compressor and hose!!! I just ordered a flooring stapler too, so can't wait to use that as well. Dewalt is the bomb.com
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Gitchel

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but great quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality, ease of use and of course great brand so peace of mind. Only issue is the weight of the hand tool. Gets really heavy if using for a medium to big project. Would definitely recommend for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of the best purchases that i have made. The nail gun works great and saves time. Since time of purchase we have trimmed out 4 rooms in our home. The best part of owning this nailer is, the comfort of not having to drag the air compressor hose all over the place ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason N.

customer_reviews.title: Product is weak
customer_reviews.text: lasted 3 months, product is weak, unfortunately still can not replace the conventional air compressor, not worth the investment
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pereira Dias

customer_reviews.title: Works well...........
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical to buy a cordless brad nailer, but the DeWalt has worked well for securing baseboards and moldings, etc. I didn’t have to buy the battery, since I already have other tools in this cordless range.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W

customer_reviews.title: Like It
customer_reviews.text: Works great, frees me up from the air hose type nailers. Another great Dewalt 20V tool to add to the collection and uses the same battery packs. It is not light though.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.M

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've made!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Just finished trimming out an entire master bathroom and it's so easy to it use. No more dragging around a gun, hose and air compressor. Shoots 2" nails with no issues. It is bigger and heavier than a pneumatic but you get used to it quickly. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: David Kaddatz

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt is made to last
customer_reviews.text: Used the 16 gage for 10 years and just broke down. Not surprised dropping it so many times all those years. This 18 gage is perfect and hope it last as the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chon

customer_reviews.title: Very economical but should be lighter
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product and fell in love with it in just one look. I couldn't with the day's going by and not owning one of these until when I got in hand I understood why there's a meaning behind every star for rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: A great finish gun.
customer_reviews.text: A very good finish gun. You need to have the nails in the right position in the track in order for it to shoot properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to not have to lug the compressor up stairs to nail in trim and baseboards. first job that we use the gun paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Ridolfo

customer_reviews.title: No packing box!
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars, but they didn’t even put it in a brown box. Seriously just the “yum yum yellow” DeWalt box that thieves love sitting on my porch! Do not order this product if your porch is visible from the road. Even an honest person will be tempted when they see this yellow dewalt box!
customer_reviews.author: erin walker

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Not really much to say this nailer worked, right out of the box as advertised. I went through two racks of 18g brad nails without charging.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I was looking for. Brad sizes all the way up to 2". I've had no malfunctions or jams. Several wood projects completed with great results.
customer_reviews.author: David Chapais

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says and like a boss!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I started a project in my house for door frames, quarter round and base trim and this thing is amazing! I'm having to much fun using it! You can switch brad sizes in a blink of the eye. Works with all my 20v Max batteries and is so simple to use! I need to buy this forever ago.
customer_reviews.author: Talen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: No longer do I have to start the compressor for trim work.
customer_reviews.author: Vikesfan

customer_reviews.title: nice gift
customer_reviews.text: wife gave it to me for a gift. great tool. so happy I don't have to lug around air compresser and air line tangle . so easy .
customer_reviews.author: arthur

customer_reviews.title: Totally Boss
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Awesome. Especially great for holding things together before putting in screws. This thing is totally boss!
customer_reviews.author: FLAFarmer

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT is hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: I typically buy DEWALT products. This seemed to stand the test of time and function properly for all of my remodel projects and Handy man projects. This products saves a lot of time and equipment in regards to having nail guns and compressors on the job site.
customer_reviews.author: Shevin Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Love it despite its size and weight.
customer_reviews.text: This works great but it is heavy and awkward in the hand. Still I love not having to tote an air compressor around to tack some trim up. One of my favorite Dewalt items.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I have used Dewalt tools for the last five years and it’s all I use now. And this works just like the rest of my Dewalt tools... perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ras S.

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to noisy compressors and hoses.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tools DeWalt has come up with. (The oscillating saw is another.) I have yet to see how the low battery warning works because the battery lasts so long! It is so convenient not to have to drag the compressor and hoses out to a small job just for a few nails. This nail gun is a game changer. I would be all over the 16 and 15 gauge versions if I had a need for them.
customer_reviews.author: James Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Way better then dragging an air hose around
customer_reviews.text: Wish these would have been available years ago.. so much faster and easier then old pneumatic nailers.
customer_reviews.author: BLSBounty

customer_reviews.title: Best cordless nailer
customer_reviews.text: Best nailer for money and durability. Easy to use, and batteries last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: GreatNorthWoods

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent nailer, out of the box ready. Was spectacle because of price. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, Dewalt rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Well when my small compressor I use for trim work developed a leak I decided to give this battery powered nailer a try. Wow, was I impressed! No hose or compressor to drag around and excellent performance. Exceeded my expectations. I only wonder what took me so long! The four stars for weight is only because I can see for some might be an issue. For me not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt is the best,  easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As always, dewalt has always been the best for me. Good quality and easy to use as expected from dewalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Akpevwe Agbo

customer_reviews.title: Freedom while nailing!!
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome, bulky, heavy, but no cables, no hose!! Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bercovich

customer_reviews.title: Sets the nail
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great gun! I use it as a Millwork carpenter in quick applications. For heavy use I still breakout the air gun and compressor. But when you have any big building you have to do something quick in, it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan lee

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really love this nailer. I put it to use immediately and very impressed with the smooth function.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne L.

customer_reviews.title: No hoses is so nice when your remodeling a house
customer_reviews.text: No hoses is so nice when your remodeling a house. Makes the job easier. Super effective. Does the job right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of the less expensive ones, they raised their price, submitted to this price but dewalt Dosent let me down
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Coville

customer_reviews.title: HPIT GUARANTEED TOUGH
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY what you would expect from a Dewalt tool, A High Performance Industrial Tool...
customer_reviews.author: SqueegeeMan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I make wooden flags for a living and use this to nail wood braces onto the backs of the flag. I have fired about 500 nails so far with no issues. Only think I dislike is that you have to reload when your down to the last 5 to 10 nails.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tareila

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Makes hand nailing seem foolish for finish carpentry. Have never had to adjust the depth despite using 5/8 thru 2" nails. As others say the gun shuts off when there is 1/2" of nails left but just start using your next round and add them in front when you have room- no waste. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Nailer!
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is easy to use and powerful. I had a Ryobi before this and there is no comparison. A little pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hoozurmama

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is a great nailer I would definitely buy it again from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: shannon richardson

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts all day
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy. Battery lasts all day. Feels awkward but you get used to it. Never misfired...
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.  My favorite tool at the moment.
customer_reviews.text: Been using the heck out of this fir trim work. Love it. So much better then lugging around a compressor and hose!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Williams

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't surprise me with a name like Dewalt!! Great price for the brad nailer and it's lightweight and easy to use. Add it to your collectoin, you won't be sorry!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like my other Dewalt equipment it has worked great
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was fast. I've been using this brad nailer for several weeks installing trim work and building a cedar chest. Like my other Dewalt equipment it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F.

customer_reviews.title: Best nail gun
customer_reviews.text: This gun is amazing. It’s quick, easy and convenient. No need to drag out the compressor and all the hoses. Rapid fire is great. Perfect for large trim jobs. Only down side is it can be a little bulky and difficult to use in really tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Carpenter 83

customer_reviews.title: sweet
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Once I learned where the brad came out where you held it, great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday at work never had a problem with it kinda heavy but built to last definitely recommend over others
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Pirila

customer_reviews.title: quik tool
customer_reviews.text: no gas no air just battery and nail best tools ever
customer_reviews.author: paul j turner

customer_reviews.title: Really well designed product
customer_reviews.text: Do not know how I did moldings in the past. Tool is a real time saver and simple to use
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: great tool, never had a single jam. a bit bulky though.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was fast. Works great. Switched to this cordless no more lugging around a compressor
customer_reviews.author: MMoria

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: Love this Dewalt 20V 18ga Brad nailer. Such a piece of mind not having to break out an air hose anymore. Prefect for smaller trim such as shoe molding or nailing outside corners together.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H Lester

customer_reviews.title: fantastic tool
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tool. I am not a professional though, so there may be better out there. For me, this thing is the cat's pajamas.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use.Do not have to worry about air hose.
customer_reviews.author: Wyman O.

customer_reviews.title: Waiting on return
customer_reviews.text: Open box placed battery an nails and it would not fire the gun. Would not shoot at all
customer_reviews.author: James Hollar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Safe and holds up very well!! Our project would have been very long without this convenient nail gun. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jill C Moore

customer_reviews.title: In summary, this nail gun was light and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We used this nail gun to install quarter round molding in our laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with it and it is convenient to use on all my projects. I install cabinets and trim for all my remodles. One of my favorite tools.
customer_reviews.author: Eli L. Ku III

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for professional and quick jobs. Excellent on battery life, best with 5amp or larger 20v
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Parker

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Life has gotten a whole lot easier, and the job too.
customer_reviews.author: Bigkb30

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 paslode nail guns and this one so far has been great and no expensive gas to buy. Pinpoint accuracy takes a bit to get used to .
customer_reviews.author: john e ciesla

customer_reviews.title: Good gun
customer_reviews.text: Good nail gun. I trim houses and not having to use a compressor is great
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Battery powerbis the way to go when it comes to using this nailer so much quieter than air powered tools no hoses or cords to deal with one 2ah last a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sooo easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to place the baseboards back after replacing my carpet with hardwood. This tool was a breeze to use and I had my baseboards back on my walls in no time!
customer_reviews.author: JayTee!

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the DeWalt tool family.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool, precise, strong, and all that without the cumbersome compressor and hose. Will keep the old pneumatic brad nailer for a while, but can definetly see it on CraigsList very soon... Drwaback, little on the heavier side (compared to the pneumatic nailer) but absolutely managable. When used with a 2Ah 20V MAX battery, it’s not overly heavy and the charge will easily last most of the day. Fast rapid fire or accurate placement possible. Great addition to the DeWalt tool family I have.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this more then what I thought I would
customer_reviews.author: joshua cisco

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to get the hose away from my feet
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Already made 6 bird houses with the grandkids and some other crafts. Easy to use, quality Dewalt tool. I have many other projects it will be used to create.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is it does waste about 5-10 nails. Other than that it’s another great product by Dewalt
customer_reviews.author: B.M

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little big and bulky, but if you don’t need to get it into tight space, it’s great! Definitely recommend, you won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Chill

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Gets in tight spots with the swivel head. Used to frame a closet and build shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon service
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome you don't need a compressor hose any more
customer_reviews.author: juan colon

customer_reviews.title: Useable
customer_reviews.text: Good and reliable. A little bulky and tough in corners
customer_reviews.author: mark watkins

product_meta.title: DEWALT 20V MAX Cordless Brad Nailer, 18GA, Tool Only (DCN680B)
product_meta.description: The DEWALT 20V max XR 18 gauge brad nailer (Dcn680) drives 18 gauge brad nails from 5/8" To 2-1/8", making it ideal for fastening decorative molding, casing, kitchen crown, and shoe molding. Battery and charger not included. The DEWALT 20V max XR 18 gauge brad nailer (tool only) (Dcn680) drives 18 gauge brad nails from 5/8" To 2-1/8", making it ideal for fastening decorative molding, casing, kitchen crown, and shoe molding. With its brushless motor powered by a DEWALT 20V max* Lithium-Ion battery, The Dcn680 is ready to go without the hassle of using Gas, compressor, and hose. Tackle jobs both large and small with the features of a Pneumatic tool and the freedom of cordless. Battery and charger not included. 100% battery power Eliminates the hassle of using Gas, compressor, and hose Brushless motor maximizes runtime and durability micro nose improves line of sight and accuracy of nail placement (compared to DEWALT DC608) tool-free depth adjustment for precise Countersinking of nails in the box: one (1) 20V max XR 18 gauge brad nailer
feature_bullets: Diagnostics with LED indicator Communicates battery charge status: charged
Automatic shut-off protects excessive discharge of vehicle's battery
*Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 volts. Nominal voltage is 18
